intro: Sphaeralcea eremicola, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its glandular, hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats. Sphaeralcea eremicola is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and drought conditions.
